drug.name: Liothyronine I-131
drug.description: Liothyronine I-131 has been used in trials studying the treatment of Tricuspid Atresia and Heart Defects, Congenital.

classification.description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as phenylalanine and derivatives. These are compounds containing phenylalanine or a derivative thereof resulting from reaction of phenylalanine at the amino group or the carboxy group, or from the replacement of any hydrogen of glycine by a heteroatom.

drug-interaction.name: Conjugated estrogens
drug-interaction.description: The therapeutic efficacy of Liothyronine I-131 can be decreased when used in combination with Conjugated estrogens.

polypeptide.name: Thyroxine-binding globulin
polypeptide.specific-function: Major thyroid hormone transport protein in serum.
